benchmark_details.name: CharacterBox
benchmark_details.overview: CharacterBox is a simulation sandbox designed to generate situational fine-grained character behavior trajectories to evaluate the role-playing capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) more comprehensively. It consists of a character agent, grounded in psychological and behavioral science, and a narrator agent that coordinates interactions between character agents and environmental changes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dynamic, multi-agent interactive virtual world for evaluating the role-playing capabilities of LLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Runtime efficiency needs improvement for large-scale evaluations.

data.source: Utilizes diverse scenes from well-known novels and scripts for role-playing evaluations.
data.annotation: Human experts annotate character trajectories based on detailed evaluation criteria.

methodology.calculation: Each metric is scored from 1 to 5 based on evaluator assessments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate stronger role-playing performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance results indicate varying abilities across different LLMs evaluated.
methodology.validation: Validated through correlations with expert evaluations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Includes evaluations across different character profiles.
